meanings.definition: A small room in a prison or monastery.
meanings.sent1: The prisoner spent the night in a dark cell.
meanings.sent2: The monk meditated in his quiet cell.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat sneaked into the empty cell and got stuck.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt like a lonely cell, isolated from the world.
meanings.sent5: The damp, cold walls of the cell echoed every sound.

meanings.definition: A small compartment in a honeycomb.
meanings.sent1: The bee stored nectar in each cell of the honeycomb.
meanings.sent2: The sweet honey filled every cell of the comb.
meanings.sent3: The hungry bear eagerly searched for the last cell with honey.
meanings.sent4: The hexagonal shape of each cell in the honeycomb fascinated the scientist.
meanings.sent5: The golden sunlight gleamed on the wax cell of the hive.

meanings.definition: A basic unit of life in living organisms.
meanings.sent1: The human body is made up of countless cells.
meanings.sent2: Each cell performs specific functions in the body.
meanings.sent3: The tiny cell threw a party with the mitochondria and nucleus.
meanings.sent4: In the bustling city of cells, the mitochondria was the powerhouse.
meanings.sent5: The cell danced with joy as it received nutrients and oxygen.

meanings.definition: A device for converting chemical energy into electrical energy.
meanings.sent1: The solar cell on the roof generated electricity from sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The fuel cell provided power for the remote cabin.
meanings.sent3: The portable cell charger saved the day during the blackout.
meanings.sent4: Her invention revolutionized the efficiency of the energy cell.
meanings.sent5: The small cell hummed softly as it converted energy for the device.
